title: Archive through April 09, 2004
content:
I'm surprised that the creator of this typeface   
hasn�t dropped in yet. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
author: bjharvey

comments.content: Mark Simonson's Coquette Bold k?
Ignacio, Bingo! Your turn. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)

Good clue bj, my first one here :-)   
   
 ![Quiz](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32471.gif)

Uhm, uh, uhm.. Okay.. Uh.. Uhm.   
   
What the.. "z"? "2"?
No "z", no "t" and no number...
Not k either?
No k or K
"Lowercase", 90's.

A little bit more. If it is too little tell me.   
   
 ![Quiz2](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32475.gif)

Yes it is.   
I am not really sure if it is an alternate or lowercase, it is a kind of a mixture ...   
   
 ![Quiz3](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32480.gif)

A lowercase b or an alternate for B.   
(That's how I see it)
Indiefonts... California.
ER 9 from TPC

�Si Se�or! Test Pilot ER9 Light, by Matt Desmond.   
Good try Tiffany and sorry if I didn't explained it correctly.   
   
 ![Quizfinal](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32483.gif)   
   
Your turn bj.

thanks Ignacio.   
   
�or the next one, a slightly different approach: showing   
the glyphs sted of cropping.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32490.gif)

the lowercase g from P22 Cage Silence was   
my second choice.   
   
btw, the link for ER9 is below   
   
http://www.myfonts.com/Search?searchtext=er9
Chwast Buffalo

yes Franz! Steps up with the five-minute Pop Quiz ID ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
your turn   
   
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/chwast-buffalo/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/chwast-buffalo/)

That was almost too easy - I was lucky that everyone else was asleep! (It's 3:00am CEST right now)   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32493.gif)

Different glyph:   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32515.gif)

The foundry was featured in the books, but I don't know about the typeface.. I don't have the books, I'm a poor student. ![:-(](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/sad.gif)   
   
The name of the face is really nice.
Smallish foundry, California..

Correct, it's PSY/OPS [Franzen](http://web.archive.org/www.psyops.com/html/spec_franzen.html)! My, what a great name. ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/bigsmile.gif)
It's a 2, and it's French.
[Ambroise Francois Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204/http:/www.typofonderie.com/alphabets/view/Ambroise).

Rock paper scissors?   
   
 [http://www.worldrps.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204/http:/www.worldrps.com/)

I was gonna say, That site is kinda funny if you   
actually check it out.   
People soooo into something the rest of the world   
finds obscure.   
   
But the rock paper scissors folk might say   
the same thing about this site. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)   
   
(Assuming that the RPS site is not satire)
Typography has gotten a LOT less obscure now that everyone has a PC. My money says 20 years ago very few people outside the design industry knew what a font was.
I think you should just post a new quiz, Tiff. Not a 'tie-breaker'.
Colmcille roman n
Linotype Eirinn, n
r!
Whoo! "r", who would've thought.. New challenge coming up later today.
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32862.gif)

Yes.. Not originally though.   
   
Different glyph:   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516143204im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/32950.gif)
Whatever it is, it's seriously nice.
